dc:title:
From Union Square to Rome,
Chapter 7 - Reporting
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Describes her life as an advocacy journalist depicting the misery of the poor and working class. Engages in picketing, organizing, and anti-conscription activities. An account of being jailed with suffragettes and their hunger strike. Theme of being "tormented by God" and impulses toward faith recurs.
